intro: Didissandra rosthornii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces yellowish flowers that are followed by small, round, greenish fruits. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its unique appearance and medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and traditional healers alike.
